intro: Oxyphyllum ulicinum, commonly known as the narrowleaf oxyphyllum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shady areas. It is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions for ornamental purposes. Oxyphyllum ulicinum is valued for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
